item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Been chatting with a bunch of S-tier builders and all of them are tired with the scams and grifting in our space
We need, as an industry, to self-regulate
If we don't, we will be regulated. violently and unilaterally
ball's in our court
item.dc:creator: @odysseas_eth
item.description:

ball's in our court

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Danny changes the game for Etherealize, and for Ethereum as a whole. His leadership and coordination superpowers will be a huge boost for Ethereum. Last year saw ETH experience some growing pains, but I couldn't be more excited about its future now.
Welcome to the team, Danny!
item.dc:creator: @gphummer
item.description:
Danny changes the game for Etherealize, and for Ethereum as a whole. His leadership and coordination superpowers will be a huge boost for Ethereum. Last year saw ETH experience some growing pains, but I couldn't be more excited about its future now.

Welcome to the team, Danny!

item.title: My roadmap for @class_lambda: to work as closely with @Etherealize_io and @Consensys as they want to fight back against external competitors and to make sure the protocol advances but remains credible neutral.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: My roadmap for @class_lambda: to work as closely with @Etherealize_io and @Consensys as they want to fight back against external competitors and to make sure the protocol advances but remains credible neutral.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Etherealize is basically Foundation #2. This is a pivotal political moment for Ethereum...there was indeed a bit of a cultural splinter and many people on one side of it are (on a friendly basis) splintering into Etherealize.
As a result, Ethereum's L0 will be even more socially decentralized---similar to "client diversity" there is now a marketplace for competing top-level strategic visions for Ethereum, how to market ETH, etc.
This decentralization has always been Ethereum's strength and unique selling point as compared to other smart contract chains. Onward.
item.dc:creator: @lex_node
item.description:
Etherealize is basically Foundation #2. This is a pivotal political moment for Ethereum...there was indeed a bit of a cultural splinter and many people on one side of it are (on a friendly basis) splintering into Etherealize.

As a result, Ethereum's L0 will be even more socially decentralized---similar to "client diversity" there is now a marketplace for competing top-level strategic visions for Ethereum, how to market ETH, etc.

This decentralization has always been Ethereum's strength and unique selling point as compared to other smart contract chains. Onward.

nitter.freedit.eu/ethereumfndn/status/1895851925343515128#m

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: welcome back, Danny
tbh this is incredibly bullish for Ethereum
at @Etherealize_io Danny will be able to foster a culture of *excellence* alongside world class business operators & devs
you know, maybe Etherealize is the second foundation we needed this whole time ü•≥

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: We‚Äôre beyond excited for Danny to join as Etherealize‚Äôs cofounder.
Our mission is to connect the world to Ethereum. And Danny is the perfect person to bring Ethereum to the world.
Danny ‚Äî thank you for all you‚Äôve done for Ethereum thus far. This next chapter will be epic.
item.dc:creator: @Etherealize_io

Our mission is to connect the world to Ethereum. And Danny is the perfect person to bring Ethereum to the world.

Danny ‚Äî thank you for all you‚Äôve done for Ethereum thus far. This next chapter will be epic.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: For 2025 we need Fusaka on L1 with PeerDAS, ideally with 48/72 blob target/limit
Let's aim to get a Fusaka testnet with these blob parameters running the day after Pectra goes live.
item.dc:creator: @VitalikButerin
item.description:
For 2025 we need Fusaka on L1 with PeerDAS, ideally with 48/72 blob target/limit

Let's aim to get a Fusaka testnet with these blob parameters running the day after Pectra goes live.
